alert.note: Alert for Central Walton; Inland Bay; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; South Walton; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 02 at 4:46AM EDT until September 05 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend and Panhandle Florida, including the following areas, in Big Bend Florida, Coastal Bay, Coastal Franklin and Inland Franklin. In Panhandle Florida, Central Walton, Coastal Gulf, Inland Bay, Inland Gulf, South Walton and Washington. * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A backdoor front currently draped across the Florida Panhandle will lead to the possibility of training thunderstorms with the ability to produce heavy rainfall rates due to 2.25-2.5 inch PWATs over the region. These training thunderstorms and heavy rainfall rates will lead to the possibility of localized flash flooding across these zones, especially in poor drainage and low lying areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
